answers.answer: An A1c is a measure of average blood sugar (BG)  an average of 6 is above normal.Carbohydrates raise BG  ALL carbs raise BG  a normal persons pancreas squerts out insulin to lower BG.  When the person has higher than normal BG it means ether there pancreas does not make enough insulin and or the insulin is not used correctly (insulin resistance).A normal person eats carbs pancreas releases stored insulin BG does not rise, If more insulin is needed the pancreas makes more.An A1c of 6 and 2 hour BG means your probably going High after you eat before the 2 hour mark.  Try testing at 45 min or 1 hour.ORyou are one of the people where the A1c is not a true indicator of your BG.Ask for a OGtT  test Oral Glucose Tolerance Test.  This is a much better test of how your pancreas functions.In the test you drink a glucose surape and be sure they test your BG every 15 or 20 minutes.  not just 2 hours

I had a 2 hour test done that's when I was diagnosed.  But they didn't check my sugar every 15 mins.   I guess it's hard to understand how I can have diabetes if my numbers are good.  I go next month an plan on talking to the doctor!  Thanks for your response :)
"They" are moving the threshold down to 5.7 for diabetes.

Is that a fact?  Haven't heard about that one, but it is interesting looking at old labs of mine how they've narrowed the "normal" ranges in recent times.  Makes one very suspicious on how much big pharma is influencing it.

question: I have a questions.   The doctor says I am diabetic, however my a1c has been under 6 for the past few 3 month checks.  The past few times I have checked my sugar it's in the 70-80 range.   I'm afraid it's getting to low!  Example. I ate at around 1230 an around 230 my sugar was 82, is that normal??I just don't understand how this all works!  Thanks for any help!
title: Could use some help.....
